titlestmt.titleproper: African, Afro-, Native American, and Pacific Rim Arts Lantern Slide Collection
African, Afro-, Native American, and Pacific Rim Arts Lantern Slide Collection
titlestmt.author: Compiled by Helen Chillman

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Saturday December 8, 2018 at 00:17

did.unittitle: African, Afro-, Native American, and Pacific Rim Arts Lantern Slide Collection
did.abstract: Collection consists of black and white glass lantern slides of the arts of African, Native American, and Pacific Rim cultures, including Australia and New Zealand, as well as Afro-Brazilian, Afro-Cuban, Afro-Haitian, Afro-Mexican, Afro-Portuguese, Afro-Surinam, and Afro-American arts.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright has not been transferred to Yale University. Further use of this material may be subject to the copyright laws of the United States (Title 17, United States Code) or to site license or other rights management terms or conditions.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: African, Afro- , Native American, and Pacific Rim Arts Lantern Slide Colleciton, Arts Library, Yale University.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Collection consists of black and white glass lantern slides of the arts of African, Native American, and Pacific Rim cultures, including Australia and New Zealand, as well as Afro-Brazilian, Afro-Cuban, Afro-Haitian, Afro-Mexican, Afro-Portuguese, Afro-Surinam, and Afro-American arts. Note: The African arts section was begun in the late 1950s and represents the earliest organization of this material. Names of peoples and locations used here may no longer be current and spellings will vary. Country boundaries may have changed.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged into four principal sub-collections: Africa, Afro- ,Native American, and Pacific Rim. Sub-arranged principally by location.

odd.head: General
odd.p: All arts (sculpture, painting, textiles, etc.) are interfiled in a single sequence,

odd.head: General
odd.p: All categories are interfiled (architecture, sculpture, painting, textiles, etc.)

odd.head: General
odd.p: This small category covers Pacific island cultures, New Zealand, and Australia
